author: sky.cactus
content: Not all networks support legacy transaction types, but a subset of those *have* manually deployed the above proxy.

author: sky.cactus
content: The idea is that any chain can deploy the proxy manually (precompile essentially) and then from then on you never need to do a crafted signature transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: It would be quite annoying for them to have to manually deploy a second transaction without a good reason, and I would argue that using the proxy is *less* steps for any existing chain that already has the proxy (many of them, including all public testnets).
